meanings.definition: Covered with a layer of blue-gray clay
meanings.sent1: The gleyed field looked like it had a blanket of blue-gray clay on top.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a gleyed sky in the background of the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The gleyed walls of the house made it seem like a cozy clay fortress.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a gleyed hue, reminiscent of a stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The gleyed landscape was a peaceful sea of blue-gray tranquility.

meanings.definition: To treat or mix with blue-gray clay
meanings.sent1: The potter gleyed the clay to create a unique shade for her vase.
meanings.sent2: She gleyed the soil before planting the seeds to improve water retention.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to gley the ingredients together for a special dish.
meanings.sent4: He gleyed the paint with blue-gray pigment to achieve the perfect color.
meanings.sent5: The artist gleyed the canvas, adding depth and texture to the painting.
